children.title: cross, the
children.comment: An instrument of execution, used especially by the Roman authorities for putting criminals to death. The sufferings of Jesus Christ on the cross, foreshadowed in the OT, are related in the NT gospel accounts. Scripture sees the death of Christ as central to the Christian faith. Through the cross and resurrection of Christ, God achieved the redemption of believers.

children.title: cross, predictions of
children.comment: The death of Jesus Christ fulfils OT predictions and was clearly anticipated in his teaching.

children.title: The cross foreshadowed in the OT
Jesus Christ predicts his death on the cross
Jesus Christ's first announcement of his death
Jesus Christ's second announcement of his death
Jesus Christ's third announcement of his death
In the teaching of Jesus Christ

primaryrefs.comment: John the Baptist's fate indicates what is to happen to Jesus Christ.

children.title: In the experience of Jesus Christ

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ's reaction to the woman anointing him seems to suggest that he will die the death of a criminal.

children.title: God's perfect timing for Jesus Christ's death on the cross

primaryrefs.comment: To be nailed to a cross is the equivalent of being hanged on a tree.

children.title: cross, Gospel accounts of
children.comment: Each of the four Gospels provides a detailed account of Jesus Christ's death on the cross.

children.title: Simon is compelled to carry the cross
Women follow the cross and Jesus Christ is offered relief from pain
Jesus Christ crucified between two criminals

primaryrefs.comment: ``Golgotha'' is a transliteration of the Aramaic word for ``a skull''. Its actual location is uncertain.

children.title: The humiliation of Jesus Christ on the cross
The words of Jesus Christ on the cross

seealsos.comment: According to John, Jesus Christ was on the cross while the Passover lambs were being sacrificed.

children.title: cross, centrality of
children.comment: The death of Jesus Christ on the cross is central to the Christian faith. Through the cross and resurrection of Christ, God achieved the redemption of believers and brought hope to the world.

children.title: The gospel as the ``message of the cross''
The cross redeems from the curse of the law
The cross brings reconciliation and justification
The cross destroys the power of Satan

The cross unites believers with Jesus Christ
The cross as a symbol of discipleship

gospel
children.comment: The good news of God's redemption of sinful humanity through the life, death and resurrection of his Son Jesus Christ.

children.title: gospel, historical foundation of
children.comment: The gospel rests upon the history of Jesus Christ: his birth, obedient life, atoning death, physical resurrection from the dead and his ascension into heaven.

children.title: The sinless life of Jesus Christ

seealsos.comment: in relation to the resurrection of believers

children.title: gospel, confirmation of
children.comment: The trustworthiness of the gospel of Jesus Christ rests upon the fulfilment of OT prophecies concerning Jesus Christ, the apostolic witness to Jesus Christ and the divine witness to Jesus Christ during his ministry, culminating in his resurrection.

children.title: Prophecies of the OT concerning Jesus Christ
Fulfilment of prophecy recognised by Jesus Christ
Fulfilment of prophecy recognised by NT speakers and writers

secondaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ as the greater Moses
Jesus Christ as the high priest after the order of Melchizedek

primaryrefs.comment: Jesus Christ fulfils all that the sacrificial system stood for.

children.title: Witness of the apostles to Jesus Christ
Witness of God the Father to his Son
Jesus Christ vindicated by his resurrection
gospel, essence of
children.comment: The chief characteristic and fundamental doctrine of the gospel is that Jesus Christ is both Lord and Saviour.

children.title: The universal lordship of Jesus Christ
Personal implications of the lordship of Jesus Christ
The lordship of Jesus Christ can only be acknowledged through divine inspiration and revelation
Jesus Christ is the promised Messiah
Jesus Christ did everything that was required to save his people

primaryrefs.comment: He fulfilled all God's righteous requirements, made perfect atonement for sin and gained victory over death for all who believe in him.

children.title: Salvation comes only through Jesus Christ
Jesus Christ will return to judge the world and bring his people to glory
gospel, promises of
children.comment: To all who believe and submit to its demands, the promises of the gospel include forgiveness of sins, new life in Jesus Christ and adoption into the family of God.

children.title: The sin of God's people is imputed to God's Son
The righteousness of God's Son is imputed to God's people
The gift of the Holy Spirit
gospel, requirements of
children.comment: The gospel demands an obedient response to all that God has done for humanity in Jesus Christ. This includes faith in God, trust in the work of Jesus Christ, the repenting of sin, being baptised, and becoming like Christ through discipleship.

children.title: A conscious change of mind and heart
The requirement of public confession of Jesus Christ
Willingness to learn from Jesus Christ
Willingness to suffer for the sake of Jesus Christ
gospel, responses to
children.comment: The gospel cannot be subscribed to half-heartedly or in part; it must be either accepted or rejected.

children.title: The gospel calls for a positive response
The command to accept the gospel
Examples of people who accepted the gospel

seealsos.comment: Matthew was also known as Levi

children.title: Examples of people who rejected the gospel
gospel, transmission of
children.comment: The gospel has been passed down through the NT witness to Jesus Christ, through the proclamation of the good news about Jesus Christ, and through the providential guidance of the Holy Spirit.

children.title: The NT witness to Jesus Christ
The events of Jesus Christ's life were carefully recorded
The apostles bore witness to the gospel
The guidance of the Holy Spirit in the transmission of the gospel
gospel, descriptions of
children.comment: The beauty, authority and importance of the gospel can be seen from the way it is described in Scripture.

children.title: As being complete and gloriously rich
